definition: Hai Rui (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity

lucky/auspicious/propitious/rayl (acoustical unit)
Hai Rui dismissed from office, 1960 historical play by historian Wu Han 吳晗|吴晗

sentences.english: Hai Rui was an honest and upright official in the Ming Dynasty . He led a very simple life.
sentences.chinese: 海瑞斯明代的一个大清官，他生活也很简朴。

sentences.english: Hai Rui only wore simple and coarse clothes .
sentences.chinese: 海瑞平时只穿粗布衣服。

sentences.english: But why did he die on Longshan Island and why was this temple built?
sentences.chinese: 可是为什么要在龙山岛上建海瑞祠呢？

sentences.english: Good afternoon, Mr. Kono. I'll contact Mr. Harris and let him know you've arrived.
sentences.chinese: 午安，河野先生，我会联络海瑞先生，告诉他您到了。
上海瑞印刷技术有限公司。

sentences.english: ' I don't know, go play, Hailie baby, your daddy's busy.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，自己去玩，海瑞宝贝，你爸爸在忙着呢。

sentences.english: Hai Rui was born on Hainan Island.
Hai Rui was a well-known honest and upright official in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 海瑞可是中国历史上有名的清官。

sentences.english: Harry's father did not allow him to speak at mealtimes . And, Harry always obey the rules very well.
sentences.chinese: 海瑞的父亲不允许他吃饭说话，海瑞也总是很守规矩。

sentences.english: Harry's father did not allow him to speak at mealtimes . And, Harry always obey the rules very well.
sentences.chinese: 海瑞的父亲不允许他吃饭说话，海瑞也总是很守规矩。

sentences.english: If you want to visit more seas, HaiRui Tomb is worth visiting.
sentences.chinese: 如果还想参观的话，海瑞墓值得一游。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Bao Zheng (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty/modern day metaphor for an honest politician
popular nickname of Hai Rui 海瑞[Hai3 Rui4] (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition

Zhang Tingyu (1672-1755), Qing politician, senior minister to three successive emperors, oversaw compilation of History of the Ming Dynasty 明史[Ming2 shi3] and the Kangxi Dictionary 康熙字典[Kang1 xi1 Zi4 dian3]
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
county head magistrate (old)
district magistrate/county magistrate
upright and honest
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
prefectural magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
